title: UnityBase configuration
description:
Property values in the configuration may include:
  • `%ENV_VAR%` - will be replaced by value of OS environment variable with the same name
  • `"#include(pathToFile)"` - will be replace by content of file `pathToFile`
  • Can be combined as such: `"#include(%UB_HOME%/models/defHeadersPostprocessors.json)"`

serverType.description:
The type of HTTP server. For Windows default is HTTPSys, for Linux - Socket

 |Value  |Description
|-
| `None`|No HTTP server
| `HTTPSys`| HTTP.sys kernel mode driver used. Fast, but require URL to be written to routing table using _ub -http register_ command 
| `Socket` | Plain socket. Require reverse proxy for production usage

protocol.description: Communication protocol. For SSL based protocols additional steps required for setting up a certificates. See this article

host.description:
Host names for server. Could be either a fully qualified case-insensitive domain name,
an IPv4 or IPv6 literal string,
or a wildcard ('+' will bound to all domain names for the specified port, '*' will accept the request when no other listening host names match the request for that port

path.description:
Begin of URL to listen on. Server will listen on `protocol://host:port/path`.
Several HTTPSys based server instances can share the same `host:port` combinations with the different paths

externalURL.description: URL that the User will use to access your server. To be used in case server is behind a reverse proxy

additionalURLs.description: Additional URLs to listen on. Must be registered MANUALLY in the HTTP.SYS routing table

threadPoolSize.description: Working thread count. Default is SystemThreadCount available for application based on process affinity mask

inetPub.description: Path to folder with static files, applicable to server. Model-specific files must be placed inside models `public` folder

inetIndex.description: If a static file request ends with a slash, UB treats it as a request for a directory and tries to find an index file in the directory. The `inetIndex` directive defines the index file name (the default value is `index.html`)

headersPostprocessors.description: Rules, applied to static-files responses. Response headers can be overrated here. In case server is behind the nginx it is better to remove `headersPostprocessors` and generate ngonx config using `npx ubcli generateNginxCfg` command

location.description: Regular expression. If static file response file name much this regExp, rule is applied

useETag.description: FileAge will be used as ETag header value. Also Last-Modified header will be added to work correctly with HTTP 1.0 based proxy (squid <= 3.2)

expires.description:
Values in seconds for adding `Expires: ServerStartDate + expires` header. Do not set this value to more than one year (HTTP protocol not allow this).
Google recommendation: We prefer Expires over Cache-Control: max-age because it is is more widely supported see it here

addHeader.description: Add any header(s) to response. Example: `"Cache-Control: max-age=7776000"` (space after **:** is IMPORTANT!)

usePreparedGzip.description: If `true` and request header contain Accept-Encoding: *gzip*, then server seek for file with name fileName + '.gz' and if present - send content of this file,together with header  "Content-Encoding: gzip". See also `ub cmp/prepareGZIP` command

watchFileChanges.description: Enable watching of `inetPub` & model folders modification

enabled.description: If `true` server will recalculate UB_STATIC.* GlobalCache entries each time something changes. Set it to `false` in case you restart production server during version update

hashingStrategy.description:
How to calculate hash of folders |Value |Description |- | `ContentMD5`| Folder hash is a MD5 of all it content. Slow, but strongly recommended on production (together with enabled: false).
In this case even if you copy new files with same content, folder checksum do not changed and proxy/browser cache will continue to use cached data | `ModifyDate`| Fast, usd for for developer purpose

requestQueueLength.description:
Request queue length.
Increase this value in case of many invalid responses or in case in HTTP.sys log files (normally in _C:\Windows\System32\LogFiles\HTTPERR\httperr\*.log_) you see QueueFull messages.
In case of Linux and server is behind the reverse proxy we recommend do set this value to 100 to enable a quickly reballancing

maxBandwidth.description: The maximum allowed bandwidth rate in bytes per second (via HTTP API 2.0). Setting this value to 0 allows an unlimited bandwidth (default)

maxConnections.description:
The maximum number of HTTP connections allowed (only for Vista+ or Windows Server2008+).
Setting this value to 0 allows an unlimited number of connections (default)

allowCORSFrom.description:
Origins for cross-origin resource sharing (CORS). See mozilla documentation
Can be set e.g. to '"*"' to allow requests from any sites, or specify an URI to be allowed as origin (e.g. 'http://foo.example'). By default (empty) CORS are not allowed

compression.description: Enable traffic compression. For individual response compression applied if response body size > 1024 and request contains Accept-Encoding: header

timeouts.description: For advanced use only! Will override a http protocol timeouts. See this article for details

entityBody.description: The time, in seconds, allowed for the request entity body to arrive

drainEntityBody.description: The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to drain the entity body on a Keep-Alive connection

requestQueue.description: The time, in seconds, allowed for the request to remain in the request queue before the application picks it up

idleConnection.description: The time, in seconds, allowed for an idle connection

headerWait.description: The time, in seconds, allowed for the HTTP Server API to parse the request header

minSendRate.description: Set it to 0 to remove limit at all. The minimum send rate, in bytes-per-second, for the response. The default response send rate is 150 bytes-per-second

reverseProxy.description: Reverse proxy settings. It is strictly recommended to use reverse proxy on production

kind.description: Server what used as a reverse-proxy.

remoteIPHeader.description: The value of a custom HTTP header containing the real client IP. By default, the RemoteIP information will be retrieved from the socket layer - but if the server runs behind some proxy service, you should define here the HTTP header name which indicates the true remote client IP value, mostly as 'X-Real-IP' or 'X-Forwarded-For'

remoteConnIDHeader.description: The value of a custom HTTP header containing the real client connection ID. Required for Kerberos/UBLDAP authentication and correct logging of real client connection ID. In case of nginx value is taken from $connection nginx variable

sendFileHeader.description: Send static files using reverse proxy X-Sendfile feature. For nginx should be `X-Accel-Redirect`

sendFileLocationRoot.default: externalURL hostname with '.' replaced by '-' (http://test.com -> test-con)
sendFileLocationRoot.description: Prefix added to the beginning of sendFileHeader location

host.description: Host names for server. See `httpServer.host` for details. If empty - WS server do not run at all

path.description: Begin of URL to listen on. Server will listen on `protocol://host:port/path`

pingTimeout.description: Ping (verification of the fact that the WS connection is alive) in seconds. 0 means no ping send.

levels.description: Type of events to put to log file. "*" - all events. To enable logging of a remote debug protocol on log level Custom4 set an environment variable FF_RDP_DEBUG=true

path.description: Path to folder where server place log files (including rotated logs). Keep it empty to disable output of logs logs to the files

rotationSizeInMB.description: If log file reaches this size, it will be rotated. 0 mean no rotation. If !==0 then `threadingModel` will switch to `IdentifiedInOnFile`

threadingModel.description:
How threads write information to log

 |Value  |Description
|-
| `OneFilePerThread`|will create one .log file per thread(fastest)
| `MergedInOneFile`| will indicate that all threads are logged in the same file, in occurence order
| `IdentifiedInOnFile` | like MergedInOneFile, but a new column will be added for each log row, with the corresponding ThreadID

slowQueryThreshold.description: If database query execution (**including** fetching data) exceed this time (in millisecond) such query will be put in the log with logLevel `Custom2`

flushTimeOut.description: The time (in seconds) after which the log content must be written on disk, whatever the current content size is. In all case the log file will be written for every 4 KB of log

stackTrackDepth.description: The recursive depth of stack trace symbol to write. Used only if exceptions are handled, or by StackTrace level. 0 mean no stack trace

performanceCounters.description: Enable Windows Performance Counters Set with name _UnityBase_. Set must be registered using `ub -perf` command. See this article for details

timeout.description: Script execution timeout (in seconds). -1 mean unlimited

lifetimeInMinutes.description: Context lifetime (in minutes). After this period context will be recreated. Set to small value if your application have a memory leak inside JS

fullGCPeriod.description: Number of incoming request handled by current thread after which server perform a full GC. Setting this number to small value will slow down the server, but help to protect against `out of memory` in bad designed code. Full garbage collection is a long operation, so setting this parameter to small value will slow down a server

maxPerEngineMemory.description: Maximum amount of memory (in megabytes) accessible for one JS engine. Every thread have his own engine and all threads share the same process memory (max 3.7Gb for 32 bit app). It is important to find a balance between the number of threads and maxPerEngineMemory

debuggerListenOn.description: [IP_Adress:]port where remote debugger is listen on. If IP_Address is omitted - 0.0.0.0 will be used. Debugger enabled only in -dev mode

forceNTLM.description: Will force a NTLM usage for Negotiate authentication method. If false - Kerberos will be used in most case

domainMap.description: Dictionary for converting fully qualified domain names to NT4-style NetBIOS names (Linux only). If empty or key not found then FQND will be truncated on first dot

ldapCatalogs.description: If `userName` passed to `auth` in form `DOMAIN\domainUser` and `UBLDAP` is present in `authenticationMethods` user credentials will be checked by request to LDAP catalog using curl. **WARNING** - ldap password is passed in plain text other network, so server should accept only HTTPS connection to be secure

URL.description: LDAP query; % placeholder will be replaced by user name. UB will send this query directly to LDAP server with username/password passed from client using curl; Example: "ldaps://myldap.server:636/OU=MyCompany,DC=myldap,DC=server?cn?sub?(sAMAccountName=%)"

CAPath.description: Unix only: optional path to folder with CA certificates. See https://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html

ignoreSSLCertificateErrors.description: Ignore SSL certificates errors (sets SSLVerifyPeer and SSLVerifyHost to false); **NOT RECOMMENDED**

jsonRequestsOnly.description: Limit request types only to JSON requests

librarySettings.description: path to folder with IIT library settings files ospus.ini or osplm.ini?. If empty - IIT will try to load settings from registry (under Windows) and this will cause a problems with registry virtualisation. If settings file not exist inside specified folder it will be created

mediaType.description: порядковый индекс типа устройства начинактся с 0. на экране считать сверху вниз

keyPath.description: full path to keystore for filesystem based media type

findCertificateBySerial.description: Used with `CERT` authentication to force search for user certificates only by by serial number (without issuer)

trafficEncryption.description: encrypt client<->server traffic using DSTU algorithm. `novaLib` is required for encryption

nonEncryptedIPs.description: IP addresses for witch DSTU encryption are disabled

encryptionKeyLifeTime.description: timeout in seconds after witch client must change encryption key. 0 - unlimited

localIPs.description: Semicolon delimited list of server IP addresses. WARNING To be used ONLY in case server can't resolve local addresses automatically. In case of wrong configuration unauthorised server access is possible

skipCheckingCallerAndSessionIpEquality.description: In case some middleware intercepts Authorization requests and redirect it to UB Session IP (IP address from which session is created) may differ from CallerIP (IP address of middleware). To allow such a requests set this parameter to `true`. **WARNING** vulnerability to token interception attacks

enabled.description: If `false` all scheduler jobs are disabled for this application

rootHandler.description: Either a endpoint name (method added via `App.registerEndpoint`) or static file from `inetPub` returned during request to `/`

defaultLang.description: In case application support internationalization - default locale

models.description: Domain models. Loaded in the order in which they appear in this array

name.description: Model name. If omitted - will be taken from model package.json `config.ubmodel.name`

path.description: Path to model folder. All *.meta and *.js will be loaded from this path and it's subdirectory

publicPath.description: Path to public model folder. If model name is taken from model package.json publicPath can also be defined there

implicitlyAddedMixins.description:
An array of names of the mixins, which will be added to each entity.
For individual entity mixin can be disabled by setting `mixins.mixinName.enabled: false` in the `meta` file

connections.description:
Database connections. Main article is here Tips:
  • You can use oracle client without install it. Just copy files distributed with Oracle Instant Client to the bin\OracleInstantClient
  • To prevent storing oracle credential in config you can use Oracle Wallet
  • to prevent Oracle client disconnect in case on inactivity add the SQLNET.EXPIRE_TIME to the sqlnet.ora file on the server and set it and set it to some interval (10 for example)

name.description: Unique connection name. This name is used inside `meta` file to identify where entity are persisted

isDefault.description: Is this connection is default for application i.e used for entities without `connectionName` defined

statementCacheSize.description: The number of prepared statements, cached by database driver on the client (UB) side. 0 - disable cache (for PostgreSQL in case of multi-tenancy etc.)

dialect.description: Database dialect. We need it to properly optimize ORM for new database features

serverName.description:
Database host |DBMS |Format|Example |- | `MS SQL`|Windows: [protocol:]hostname or IP[\instanceName]; Linux: section name from `/etc/odbc.ini`| example1: `"SQLSERVER1\instance2"`
example2: "tcp:SQL_SERVER12"
example linux: "myserver" | `Oracle`| TNS_NAME or
TNS definition string| example1: "MyOraTNSName"
example: "(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=do5-s8)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVICE_NAME=ORAUTC)))" | `Postgre` | protocol://host:port | "postgresql://dodb3-s8:5432"

databaseName.description:
Name of the database

 |DBMS  |Mean|Example
|-
| `MS SQL`|Name of a database| "myDatabase" 
| `Oracle`| not applicable|  
| `Postgre` | Name of a database | "postgres" 
| `SQLite3`|Full path to database file. **Don`t use UNC path here - only local file system files is allowed**| "d:\myDB\myDatabase.db"

userID.description:
Name of user

 |DBMS  |Mean
|-
| `MS SQL`|User name for mixed authentication. "" for SSPI.
| `Oracle`| Role name or "" in case of using `oracle wallet`
| `Postgre` | Schema owner 
| `SQLite3`|Not applicable

supportLang.description: Array of supported locales (applicable to multi-language attributes) for current connection

executeWhenConnected.description:
Statements, which executed when new database connection is established
For example: ["ALTER SESSION SET NLS_COMP=LINGUISTIC","ALTER SESSION SET NLS_SORT=BINARY_CI"]

advSettings.description:
Advanced driver settings |DBMS| Value | Description |- |`Postgre`|LibLocation=`Path to 64bit libpq.dll`| "LibLocation=C:/Program Files/PostgreSQL (x86)/10/bin/libpq.dll" | `Oracle`| Combination of `MANY=hint` `ONE=hint` `INLINE_IN` `USE_WALLET`
INLINE_IN - do not use array bindings for `in` and `not in` condition
(UB5 only) LibLocation=`Path to folder with oci.dll(windows only)` | "MANY=\/*+ NO_CPU_COSTING *\/,ONE=\/*+ NO_CPU_COSTING *\/INLINE_IN,USE_WALLET,LibLocation=/usr/lib/oracle/11.2/clien64/lib" | `SQLIte3` | [Synchronous=Full or Off or Normal],[Tokenizer=stemka,TokenizerParams="stem=yes or no" "lang=uk or ru or en"]

name.description: Unique blobStore name. This name is used in `meta` file to determine where the attributes of the type `Document` store their content

isDefault.description: Is this store default for application. i.e. used for `Document` type entity attributes without store name defined

implementedBy.description: Name of module what implement a BlobStoreCustom interface for this store

path.description: Path to the folder where all files are placed

tempPath.description: Path for storing uncommitted files. Recommended to be on the same volume as `path`. In case of reverse proxy - must be inside store folder

historyDepth.description: Depth of revision history. 0 means no history

storeSize.description:
Approximate number of files to store

 |Value  |Description
|-
| `Simple`|Up to 10000
| `Medium`| Up to 500 000
| `Large` | More when 500 000
| `Monthly`| New subfolder `YYYYMM` for every month
| `Daily`| New subfolder `YYYYMM` for every month and when new folder `DD` for every day

keepOriginalFileNames.description: Put files into store using it original file names. If the same store is used for several entity/attribute client MUST guaranty unique file names between entities/attributes (e.g. use different prefix for different entity+attribute combination)

customSettings.description: Any settings, accessible inside server-side js using `App.customSettings`

fts.description: Build-in Full Text Search engine settings

uiSettings.description: Settings, passed to UI in getAppInfo method. We recommend to place here ONLY parameters, necessary for UI initialization. Client-side app can access this settings using UB.connection.appConfig.uiSettings

applicationName.description: Name of application for show on the login form. In case explicitly defined as empty string - not shown in login form. For localization can be specified as object with keys=locale: {"en": "My App", "uk": "Мій додаток"}

applicationTitle.description: Title of HTML page for adminUI

themeName.description: UI theme name. Can be name of a folder in the `inetPub\themes\` folder

loginURL.description: A custom login page.  If specified, unauthorized users will be redirected to this page

registrationURL.description: User registration page URL. If empty (default) then the registration link should not be displayed on login page

loginWindowTopLogoURL.description: Optional URL for a logo to display on the top of login form. Logo stretched to 150px height, so it is a good idea for logo to be 150x150px

endpoint.description: The entry point for a adminUI interface. In case both adminUI & portalUI is used on the same instance set this parameter to something long and unique to prevent hacking

hmrServerURL.description: @unitybase/hmr Hot module replacer web socket URL

encryptionImplementation.description: Define encryption implementation for authentication CERT. By default @ub-d/nm-dstu/injectEncription.js

requireUserName.description: Show user name field when enabled simpleCerAuth

userNameRE.description: Regular expression for user name validation

description.description: Description that show below username and password

linter.description: JavaScript linter options - used in adminUI form editor & shortcut editor. See JSHINT documentation for full options list

serverIP.description: IP address and port where OnlyOffice document server can be found in format 'ip:port'

favoriteCategoryCount.description: Number of categories (up to 4) for a favorites columns

amqpNotificationUrl.description: A url for UBClientNotifier to connect to message broker using stomp protocol over web sockets. The special value, '*', means connecting to ws[s]://<host>/ws which is useful when nginx is used to proxify requests. An example of valid url is 'ws://127.0.0.1:15674/ws' - this is for RabiitMQ with web stomp extension default configuration. For server part - set application.customSettings.amqpNotificationUrl

uriSuffix.description: Additional parameters passed to PDF viewer ULR. See https://www.adobe.com/content/dam/acom/en/devnet/acrobat/pdfs/pdf_open_parameters.pdf for details

licenseFilePath.description: For EE/DE editions - path to license file
